info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 17 at 6:25PM EDT until June 17 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 700 PM EDT FOR NORTHERN LANCASTER AND NORTHWESTERN CHESTERFIELD COUNTIES... At 625 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Van Wyck, or 8 miles northwest of Lancaster, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Law enforcement. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Lancaster, Indian Land, Pageland, Elgin, Andrew Jackson State Park, USC Lancaster, Van Wyck, Irwin, Buford, High Point Fire Station, Arrowood Estates, Tradesville, Camp Creek Fire Station, Antioch, Kirk Air Base, Taxahaw, Unity Fire Station, Lancaster Mill, Carolina Commons Shopping Center and McWhirter Airfield. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection seek shelter inside a sturdy building and stay away from windows.
